intro: Cyrtopera mannii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant produces small, round berries that contain the seeds. Cyrtopera mannii typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its unique nocturnal blooming habit makes it a fascinating subject for botanical study.
